header: Criminal Bail Application No.264/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000921­2019 Basantkumar Kapoorchand Jain …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent.

background.text: ORDER BELOW EXH.4 This is an application filed by the applicant for interim anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Cr. P. C. in C. R. No.14/2019, registered by Nigadi Police Station, under Section 406, 420, 467, 468, 506 of the Indian Penal Code.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of cr. p. c.
under section 406, 420, 467, 468, 506 of the indian penal code

arguments.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Sudhir Shah. He submitted that the accused / applicant is the senior citizen and reputed businessman. The offence in question is purely civil in nature and the relevant documents can be made available to the investigating officer. He submitted that the allegations are in respect of the one plot No.43 in Telco­Cooper Co­operative Housing Society, which in fact was given as security to the uncle of the informant when the accused / applicant entered in an agreement with said uncle viz. Kanhaiyalal Bijlani in respect of one evacuee property which said Bijlani had purchased in auction and in subsequent registered agreement the informant and his two brothers, who claimed to have acquired title over the property of Bijlani on the basis of will, have admitted that they have received Rs.4,00,000/­ as agreed in the agreement on 6­8­ 1990. He further submitted that having regard to the documents on record, he has good case to argue. But, till the reply is being filed by the respondent, interim protection may be granted to the applicant. Having regard to the documents filed on record, allegations in the FIR and the fact that the applicant is senior citizen, aged 68 years old, I find it will be proper to grant interim protection to the applicant till next date to the application. Hence, I pass the following order.

argumentSentences.text: [2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Sudhir Shah.
He submitted that the accused / applicant is the senior citizen and reputed businessman.
The offence in question is purely civil in nature and the relevant documents can be made available to the investigating officer.

He submitted that the allegations are in respect of the one plot No.43 in Telco­Cooper Co­operative Housing Society, which in fact was given as security to the uncle of the informant when the accused / applicant entered in an agreement with said uncle viz. Kanhaiyalal Bijlani in respect of one evacuee property which said Bijlani had purchased in auction and in subsequent registered agreement the informant and his two brothers, who claimed to have acquired title over the property of Bijlani on the basis of will, have admitted that they have received Rs.4,00,000/­ as agreed in the agreement on 6­8­ 1990.
He further submitted that having regard to the documents on record, he has good case to argue.
But, till the reply is being filed by the respondent, interim protection may be granted to the applicant.

Having regard to the documents filed on record, allegations in the FIR and the fact that the applicant is senior citizen, aged 68 years old, I find it will be proper to grant interim protection to the applicant till next date to the application.
Hence, I pass the following order.

order.text: ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Basantkumar Kapoorchand Jain in C. R. No. 14/2019 registered by Nigadi Police Station, under Section 406, 420, 467, 468, 506 of the Indian Penal Code, applicant be released on his furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.50,000/­ with one or more solvent sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and he shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation and shall surrender his passport to the Nigadi police station. [C] The applicant shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 24­01­2019. [3] The applicant shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 24­01­2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly.

footer: Pune, Dated/­17­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. processedText:
Criminal Bail Application No.264/2019 CNR NO. MHPU01­000921­2019 Basantkumar Kapoorchand Jain …. Applicant. Vs. State of Maharashtra …. Respondent. 
---header-ends---
ORDER BELOW EXH.4 This is an application filed by the applicant for interim anticipatory bail under Section 438 of Cr. P. C. in C. R. No.14/2019, registered by Nigadi Police Station, under Section 406, 420, 467, 468, 506 of the Indian Penal Code. 
---background-ends---
[2] Heard learned advocate Mr. Sudhir Shah. He submitted that the accused / applicant is the senior citizen and reputed businessman. The offence in question is purely civil in nature and the relevant documents can be made available to the investigating officer. He submitted that the allegations are in respect of the one plot No.43 in Telco­Cooper Co­operative Housing Society, which in fact was given as security to the uncle of the informant when the accused / applicant entered in an agreement with said uncle viz. Kanhaiyalal Bijlani in respect of one evacuee property which said Bijlani had purchased in auction and in subsequent registered agreement the informant and his two brothers, who claimed to have acquired title over the property of Bijlani on the basis of will, have admitted that they have received Rs.4,00,000/­ as agreed in the agreement on 6­8­ 1990. He further submitted that having regard to the documents on record, he has good case to argue. But, till the reply is being filed by the respondent, interim protection may be granted to the applicant. Having regard to the documents filed on record, allegations in the FIR and the fact that the applicant is senior citizen, aged 68 years old, I find it will be proper to grant interim protection to the applicant till next date to the application. Hence, I pass the following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER [1] The interim anticipatory bail is granted. In the event of arrest of applicant Basantkumar Kapoorchand Jain in C. R. No. 14/2019 registered by Nigadi Police Station, under Section 406, 420, 467, 468, 506 of the Indian Penal Code, applicant be released on his furnishing P.R. Bond of Rs.50,000/­ with one or more solvent sureties of like amount, on following conditions :­ [A] The applicant shall not tamper with the prosecution evidence in any manner. [B] The applicant shall co­operate the Investigating Officer during investigation and he shall remain present before the I. O. as and when required for interrogation and shall surrender his passport to the Nigadi police station. [C] The applicant shall not leave the jurisdiction of this court without prior permission of this Court. [2] This order of interim anticipatory bail shall remain in force till 24­01­2019. [3] The applicant shall remain present before this court on the date of hearing of main application. [4] Issue notice to the respondent, returnable on 24­01­2019. [5] Inform concerned police station accordingly. 
---order-ends---
Pune, Dated/­17­01­2019 ( Aniruddha Y. Thatte ) Additional Sessions Judge, Pune. Cri.B.A.No. 264/19 (Exh.4) 3 CNR No.MHPU01­000921­2019 I affirm that the contents of the PDF file Judgment are same word for word as per original Judgment. Name of Steno :­ Shri. V. V. Bannur Name of Court : Shri. A. Y. Thatte, District Judge 14 and ASJ, Pune. Judgment signed by PO on : ­ 17­1­2019 Judgment uploaded on :­18­1­2019
